title: Council Regulation (EEC) No 3699/88 of 24 November 1988 increasing the volume of the Community tariff quota opened for 1988 for ferro-chromium containing more than 6 % by weight of carbon
header:
COUNCIL  REGULATION (EEC) No 3699/88
of 24 November 1988
increasing the volume of the Community tariff quota opened for 1988 for ferro-chromium containing more than 6 % by weight of carbon
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The volume of the Community tariff quota opened by Regulations (EEC) No 4098/87 and (EEC) No 2065/88 for ferro-chromium containing more than 6 % by weight of carbon shall be increased from 390 000 tonnes to 570 000 tonnes.

1. A first part of the additional volume referred to in Article 1, amounting to 90 000 tonnes, shall be allocated among the following Member States:
1.2 //  // (tonnes)   // Benelux   // 12 070,   // Germany  // 30 170,   // Spain   // 10 050,   // France   // 20 120,  // Italy   // 10 050,   // United Kingdom   // 7 540.
2. The second part, amounting to 90 000 tonnes, shall constitute the reserve. Thus the reserve provided for in Article 2 (3) of Regulation (EEC) No 4098/87 shall be increased from 142 500 tonnes to 232 500 tonnes.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 24 November 1988.
For the Council
The President
V. KEDIKOGLOU
